meanings.definition: The state of being tense or stretched tight.
meanings.sent1: The tenseness of the rope was evident as it held the heavy weight.
meanings.sent2: Her muscles showed tenseness as she prepared to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tenseness around the toy mouse made it seem like a fierce hunter.
meanings.sent4: The tenseness in the air before the storm was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The tenseness of the situation made everyone hold their breath.

meanings.definition: The quality of being nervous or anxious.
meanings.sent1: His tenseness during the exam was visible through his fidgeting.
meanings.sent2: The tenseness in her voice revealed her unease about the upcoming presentation.
meanings.sent3: The tenseness in the room before the surprise party was thrilling.
meanings.sent4: The tenseness in her expression showed she was on edge.
meanings.sent5: The tenseness in his demeanor hinted at his inner turmoil.

meanings.definition: The act of making something tense or tight.
meanings.sent1: The tenseness of the fabric was due to the skilled sewing.
meanings.sent2: His tenseness of the bowstring indicated he was ready to shoot.
meanings.sent3: The tenseness of the knot made it impossible to untie.
meanings.sent4: The tenseness of the grip on the steering wheel showed his determination.
meanings.sent5: The tenseness of the bandage ensured the wound was secure.
